meanings.definition: To print or type in italics.
meanings.sent1: I will *italicise* the title of the book.
meanings.sent2: Please remember to *italicise* the important information.
meanings.sent3: Why did the computer *italicise* everything I typed?
meanings.sent4: Her words were like *italicised* whispers in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked us to *italicise* the key points for better understanding.

meanings.definition: To emphasize or highlight a word or phrase by using italics.
meanings.sent1: You can *italicise* the key terms in your essay.
meanings.sent2: It is common to *italicise* important dates in a text.
meanings.sent3: The email was so *italicised* that it caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music was *italicised* in every note he played.
meanings.sent5: She always *italicises* the main points in her presentations for clarity.
